_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - Industrial Solution Services, Inc.



Industrial Solution Services, Inc. has established a Risk Management Plan (RMP) according to the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) and the Federal EPA's Risk Management Plan (40 CFR Part 68) regulations for the Aqueous Ammonia Production System to enhance its safety practices.  Industrial Solution Services, Inc. management is extremely cautious in the handling of all chemicals and is very diligent about safety for its employees and the public.  



Industrial Solution Services, Inc. policy is to conduct all operations in a safe and conscientious manner to prevent accidental release of any hazardous material, including substances regulated through the California Accidental Release Prevention Program and Federal EPA's Risk Management Plan, i.e., aqueous ammonia.  Industrial Solution Services, Inc. trains its employees to properly handle and store hazardous materials, to minimize the possibility of adversely affecting its worker's health, the workplace, the public, and the environment.  Industrial Solution Services, Inc.'s Accidental Release Prevention policy is implemented through the management system contained in its RMP.





Stationary Source and Regulated Substance



The Aqueous Ammonia Production System at Industrial Solution Services, Inc. is comprised of three ammonia storage tanks, one aqua converter, a vent scrubber, control units and piping.  The Aqueous Ammonia Production System produces 19 wt. % and 29.4 wt. % aqueous ammonia for sale to client facilities.  





Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



Industrial Solution Services, Inc. has an RMP program in place to manage the handling of ammonia.  The program includes requirements for written operating procedures, personnel training, equipment maintenance, incident investigation, process hazard analysis, management of change and periodic review or audit of program elements.  The manageme

nt of change element addresses proper implementation of system updates to ensure that all changes are reviewed properly by knowledgeable persons, all engineering documents and operating procedures reflect the change, and affected personnel are trained on the change.  In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.





Five-Year Accident History



The Aqueous Ammonia Production System was new at the time of this submittal.  No accidents have occurred at the Industrial Solution Services, Inc. Stockton Facility  





Emergency Response Program



The Stockton Facility of Industrial Solution Services, Inc. is a normally unmanned facility which does not maintain a dedicated emergency response team.  In the event of an accidental release of a regulated substance, and emergency action plan has been developed which lists contact information for local emergency responders, as well as reporting information for the regulating agencies.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Several process and management system improvements are being considered and implemented because of the technical studies performed in the course of the development of the Risk Managements Program for the Aqueous Ammonia Production System.
